reviews.text: Met by Paul at the airport and delivered to the Hotel. Hotel is set in a quiet location 5 minutes from Lamai, perfect place if you don't wish to be in amongst the hustle and bustle. Dave and Paul were quite happy to ferry you about in their cars, but we decided to hire a Jeep to go off and explore. Dave arranged this at a very competitive rate and then had plenty of suggestions for places to visit, activities to do and places to eat.
reviews.title: Tropical calm

reviews.text: Kids loved the pool and we enjoyed relaxing on the loungers where you could get reasonably priced drinks and snacks.
reviews.title: Quiet comfort

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 weeks in September, the perfect place for peace and tranquility. Yet only 5 minutes from the Lamai beach area with all its restaurant’s bars and shops, and of course the beach which is one of the best in Koh Samui. For me though I was happy to stay by the pool during the day with full and friendly services, and go down the town by night. The rooms are big comfortable and very clean with all mod cons, the pool area, restaurant and gardens are excellent. With transfers to and from the airport, an organized rented motorbike waiting for me, and a trop off services if I was drinking, this was a hassle free holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for about a week in August/September 2012 - the staff is lovely and rooms simple but comfortable. There is a lovely pool area and you can look up into palm trees in the surrounding area. Recommend hiring a car (we paid 20 bucks a day through the hotel) and driving around the island (be careful on the roads, though) - the south west coast in particular was beautiful and so tranquil. Tropical Palm is a little away from Lamai but the owners are happy to drop people off and pick you up... food and drinks also available at the hotel which were good.
reviews.title: Tropical oasis

reviews.text: Arrived at Hotel New Years Eve, raining and all electric off, no fault of the hotel as the whole of Samui had lost electric. Although the weather for the week was up and down, the hotel made up for that, Probably the best service we have had at any hotel.
reviews.title: Another Perfect Stay

reviews.text: The hotel was about 10 min drive to beach but Paul would think nothing of taking you wherever you wanted to go in Samui, FOC and was full of Knowledge of where to go and where not to. Lamia beach was very lively, and it was nice to have the peace and tranquility of the hotel during day.
reviews.title: Excellent Place to stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was recommended to us after a bad experience in a hotel run by a French Basil Fawlty in the town and it was good advice.I spoke with Paul the day before we arrived and whilst checking vacancies,I mentioned that I had seen a motorbike I liked on the Internet and wanted to rent one.The next day we checked in to this really nice hotel and the phone rang to say my bike had arrived.I went down and this shiny bike I had asked for was ready to go.It was just the start of the excellent service we received during our stay. The room was nice,the pool was clean the staff were helpful and pleasant and although a little out of the town centre,that was good excuse to get on the bike. Thanks to Paul and the girls.Great stay.ps one small thing,more tv channels in room would be appreciated.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed staying here and deserves its rating

reviews.text: We were booked for 4 nights but stayed for 2 and in that time had to change rooms. Our room was covered in ants and we didn't sleep at all the first night because of this. We arrived in the evening and just dumped our bags and went to have dinner, so we didn't realise how bad it was until it was too late to change rooms.
reviews.title: Bad experience for us

reviews.text: The a/c also sounded like a jet engine but it was too hot to turn it off and it only had one (working) setting so this was another reason we didn't sleep. Howling dogs and roaring motorbikes at 5am, for our first night in Samui, we actually felt like we were in hell. We were ready to leave there and then, the only thing that stopped us is we were in the middle of nowhere so flagging a taxi wasn't an option.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We changed rooms the next day and it turned out they knew about the problems with the a/c. In the entire time we were there, we saw a total of 4 other people who were staying there. The place was deserted yet we still got the worst room in the house??
reviews.title: Secluded and quiet

reviews.text: The hotel is very far from civilisation and there is nothing around the hotel. The owners are very courteous and will drop you to Lamai beach but without your own transport, you feel a bit trapped.
reviews.title: Great hotel with peace and quiet

reviews.text: Look if you've come to Koh Samui you've gone there because you wanted to go to an ISLAND. And if you go to an Island you wanted to be BY THE BEACH. Not up in the jungle. If you'd wanted jungle you'd have gone to the elephants of Chang Mai. You wanted a BEACH.

reviews.text: IN my case, I got bait and switched by Google maps. On google maps this hotel was on the beach. Which is why I booked it. So I get off where it tells me to from one of those jitneys and there's nothing around. I call the hotel, they send a cab and after he turns up the road I think "oh it's a little bit away. Just a short walk." Then he keeps going. I think "Okay a longer walk." And then he turns up ANOTHER smaller steeper road and I think "okay WHERE is this place?"

What it is and where it is are this: a nice enough middle of the road hotel about twenty minutes up a winding road that one of the two thai girls I became friends with said there was no way she would drive me up at night because it had no visibility and there were some scary guys. I didn't see the latter but I definitely saw what she meant with the former.
reviews.title: We had a fantastic experience, a great place to stay!!!!!
